image.altText: A man wearing a cap and suspenders over a t-shirt stands in a field of a farm. He has a dejected expression.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's tariffs were designed to punish foreign nations who ran trade deficits with the US. Instead, the policy has put the businesses and industries he's seeking to protect in the crosshairs.

title.children: 'Never seen anything like this before': On the front lines of Trump's trade war

image.altText: Man with arms crossed and in black jacket looks sternly into the camera

props.synopsis: More than 80 per cent of unpaid superannuation goes unrecovered — and the agency in charge rarely penalises employers who do not pay it.

title.children: Compulsory super rises to 12pc from July 1, but millions are missing out

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: The economic reform round table set down for August will talk about tax reform but a strategy for the future of artificial intelligence and robots should be part of the conversation.

title.children: Productivity and tax strategy can't ignore the impact of AI and robots

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair holding a cane next to someone walking and wearing jeans.

props.synopsis: A new report has recommended four policy changes to "save" the NDIS, as negotiations between federal and state governments stall over a funding deal for a new tier of services to be set up outside the scheme.

title.children: New disability system in limbo as blueprint pitched to 'save' NDIS

image.altText: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley National Press Club

props.synopsis: The issue of gender quotas is the one philosophical and cultural mountain that the Liberal Party has never been prepared to climb. Now former PM Malcolm Turnbull and senator Maria Kovacic are the latest Liberal names to weigh in.

title.children: Sussan Ley says quotas may be a way forward for Liberal women. What's the hold-up?

image.altText: Someone sitting in front of a bank of computer screens, their shirt says "Shuffle" on the back

props.synopsis: Online casino Shuffle's executives are gambling on its own live broadcasts, despite it being banned in Australia.

title.children: An online lottery banned in Australia is streamed live from Melbourne

image.altText: Evin Prison bike

props.synopsis: Accounts from inside Tehran's Evin Prison are as harrowing as they are rare — many of those locked up inside never make it out. Now Iranian officials say 71 people were killed in an Israeli strike there last week.

title.children: Among all Israel's targets in Iran, this one left some 'in disbelief'

image.altText: Palestinian women mourning and crying out the front of a hospital.

props.synopsis: Local medics say at least 23 people were killed by Israeli air strikes and gunfire in the Palestinian enclave, as Arab states and the United States renew efforts to reach a ceasefire.

title.children: Israel begins new push in Gaza as Trump calls for hostage 'deal'

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying together.

props.synopsis: A Ukrainian fighter pilot has died in a crash while repelling a Russian night-time attack that involved hundreds of drones and missiles, the Ukrainian military said on Sunday.

title.children: Ukrainian F-16 pilot killed while repelling large Russian air attack

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren on the podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship has been reduced to 15 points, but it could have been much worse after a hair-raising moment with a backmarker in Austria.

title.children: Piastri fumes at French team after lapped driver nearly ends his race

image.altText: Small children in military uniforms are shown rifles by uniformed military officers and a kindergarten teacher.

props.synopsis: China has long been accused of repression in Tibet and a new report based on rare firsthand accounts from people inside the region sheds light on the way authorities are trying to erase local culture and language.

title.children: Tibetan children beaten at China's indoctrination boarding schools

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and in a gray jumper sitting a school photo shoot.

props.synopsis: A school principal accused of child sexual abuse was shuffled onto a series of new jobs, correspondence shows.

title.children: Documents show Victoria's education department ignored complaints about 'psychopathic rapist' principal

image.altText: Shark

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has been airlifted to hospital after he was bitten by a shark at a popular beach on the NSW Far North Coast on Sunday.

title.children: Teenage boy hospitalised after shark attack at Cabarita Beach

image.altText: A photo of a laptop with a hand on the keyboard showing a photo of damage to a drywall.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken with several workers who are urgently calling for an independent complaints mechanism that allows reports to be made anonymously and without fear of reprisal.

title.children: Workers threatened with weapons and 'jumped' inside residential care homes

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: Australia's only paper mill uses coal-fired boilers, which its new owner wants to convert to electric, but he says he has been told there is not enough power in the Tasmanian grid to support this.

title.children: Coal to electric conversion at paper mill stymied due to insufficient power grid

image.altText: A woman with a severely swollen eye stands with crossed arms in front of a Keep Out sign.

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas, 35, remains in hospital and is at risk of losing her eye after being injured during her arrest at a pro-Palestinian protest in Sydney on Friday.

title.children: 'We'll keep protesting': Injured former Greens candidate vows to fight on after police charges

image.altText: Woman with long dark hair taking selfie with father who has white beard

props.synopsis: When my mother first showed signs of dementia, I thought I knew what to expect from the aged care system, having finally secured a home care package for my father. But an even steeper learning curve was ahead.

title.children: What I learned from navigating the aged care system for a second time

image.altText: A smiling teenage girl with long, dark hair sits on a beach in a bikini top and long pants.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old's devastated mother says her memories of her time with her daughter help her smile when the world feels "unbearable".

title.children: Pheobe Bishop to be laid to rest more than six weeks after disappearance

image.altText: A graphic design of a plane, a NZ passport, a boarding pass and money.

props.synopsis: A former lawyer who received $1 million by mistake in a bank error transferred the money offshore, declared bankruptcy and left the country under a false name, a court has heard.

title.children: An alleged false passport and $1.2m: Lawyer facing bankruptcy allegations

image.altText: An older man with a green jumper and yellow shirt, stands in his backyard, and looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: The last two residents of a Paddington boarding house have been given until Monday to vacate or face eviction, forcing them to leave what has been home for a number of years.

title.children: 'I don't want to go': Tenants forced to leave Sydney boarding house

image.altText: Two police officers stand on a street outside a double storey brick home beside a white van at night.

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after a body was found at a house in Westmeadows, in Melbourne's north, yesterday.

title.children: Murder charges laid over Joshua Bishop's disappearance

image.altText: An aerial shot of Adelaide's CBD buildings, with parklands in the left corner.

props.synopsis: It's an oft-repeated tale — the battle for the Adelaide parklands — and one that is again rearing its head, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: LIV Golf in the parklands — the latest in a long history of battles over Adelaide’s heritage-listed public space

image.altText: A selfie of a man with a beard and blue eyes, standing in front of a white wall.

props.synopsis: Authorities will put "more boots on the ground" in a multi-agency search for Christopher Moore, 38, who failed to return home after a solo camping trip in NSW south coast bushland.

title.children: Search for missing hiker ramps up ahead of forecast wet weather

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera in front of a display screen.

props.synopsis: The horrible childhood experience of watching a friend taken by floodwaters in Fiji has driven Abrar Shabren to learn how floods behave. Now, in his job with Tasmania's Bureau of Meteorology, he shares his knowledge to help keep people safe.

title.children: How a Fiji childhood horror shaped a life studying floods in Australia

image.altText: a row of voting ballot boxes

props.synopsis: Can I vote online? What electorate do I live in? What is Hare-Clark? All your questions about voting early in the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Early voting in the Tasmanian state election explained

image.altText: A man in a white windbreaker points toward the sky as he raps into a microphone

props.synopsis: British authorities are reviewing footage of several performances at the Glastonbury Festival after two musical acts led their audiences in controversial chants.

title.children: Police investigate Glastonbury acts as controversial set goes ahead

image.altText: Luke Jackson celebrates a goal by pointing right finger

props.synopsis: Luke Jackson kicks two final quarter goals to lead Fremantle to a comeback win over St Kilda at Perth Stadium, capping off a tough personal week in style.

title.children: Jackson inspires Freo with final quarter heroics after personal battle

image.altText: A rugby league player with a head guard on holds the ball as a player in blue tries to tackle him

props.synopsis: The Storm condemned the Sharks to a fourth defeat in five to drop out of the NRL's top eight before the Cowboys earned a desperately needed win against the Titans.

title.children: 'We can't hide from that': Sharks fall out of NRL top eight with Storm defeat

image.altText: Amy Sayer reacts against Slovenia.

props.synopsis: A 91st-minute goal earns Slovenia a 1-1 draw with the Matildas in Perth, denying Joe Montemurro two wins from as many matches as Australia coach.

title.children: Matildas concede late goal in draw with Slovenia

image.altText: Police wagon on suburban driveway

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 28-year-old with murder after the sudden death of a 44-year-old man at Southport on Saturday night.

title.children: Man charged with murder after death of 44yo man on Gold Coast

image.altText: Jeff Bezos on a boar in black wearing sunglasses as Lauren Sanchez Bezos makes prayer hands

props.synopsis: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez Bezos's wedding in Venice continues to anger locals.

title.children: Bezos wedding sparks more protests on last day of extravaganza

image.altText: A young couple assist a fuel station attendant to service their car.

props.synopsis: Some independent petrol stations still offer old-fashioned driveway service but it's "very unusual".

title.children: Whatever happened to driveway service at petrol stations?

image.altText: A bowl of apple crisp with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a spoon. A baking tray of apple crisp sits behind it.

props.synopsis: A just-baked dessert can bring much-needed cheer on cold nights. Whether you are craving cookies or have a passion for puddings, we have you covered.

title.children: Winter means puddings, crumbles and cake. Here are our top 10
